msgSnippet: Under (at least) J2SDK 1.4, you can pass an instance of PrintStream to System.setOut(), .setErr(), and .setIn(). For instance, you can do the following to
messageBody:
Under (at least) J2SDK 1.4, you can pass an instance of PrintStream to
System.setOut(), .setErr(), and .setIn(). For instance, you can do the
following to capture stdout and stderr:

[...]
public void testMyTest() throws Exception {
ByteArrayOutputStream stdout = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
ByteArrayOutputStream stderr = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
System.setOut(stdout);
System.setErr(stderr);
[...]
}
[...]

Replace ByteArrayOutputStream with FileOutputStream to print to a file.
I haven't checked, but this probably works with JDK 1.3 as well.

I use this when an external framework I am using decides to print
information I don't need at test time or if I am writing a console based
program and want to check the output.

Subject: [junit] Redirecting Test Output


I have to test a series of previously written
applications. All of them use System.out and
System.err to output data. These applcations run
either by themselves or under a JUnit suite i wrote.

When running under JUnit, I would like to redirect the
output of the applications to a log file, while STILL
outputting my JUnit textUI.TestRunner results to the
screen.

any ideas how to do this?
